description: Numbers that are the sum of 3 distinct nonzero squares in exactly 3 ways.
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1690
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
maple: N:= 10^6; # to get all terms <= NA:= Vector(N):for a from 1 to floor(sqrt(N/3)) do  for b from a+1 to floor(sqrt((N-a^2)/2)) do    c:= [$(b+1) .. floor(sqrt(N-a^2-b^2))]:    v:= map(t -> a^2 + b^2 + t^2, c):    A[v]:= map(`+`,A[v],1)od od:select(t -> A[t]=3,[$1..N]); # _Robert Israel_, Jan 03 2016
author: _David W. Wilson_
